feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Blizzard Warning issued December 14 at 9:09PM AKST until December 15 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions due to blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as one quarter mile with whiteout conditions possible at times. * WHERE...Whittier.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Western Prince William Sound

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 8:16PM AKST until December 15 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility. Total snow accumulations of 2 inches. Winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility of one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Yukon Delta Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Yukon Delta Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 15 at 12:29AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog Early This Morning... Areas of fog situated just south of Colorado Spring down through the I-25 corridor and to the Colorado and New Mexico border, will continue to erode from north to south through the early morning hours. entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 14 at 8:16PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The river is forecast to rise into minor flood stage due to easterly winds that will deter drainage in the basin.
